channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large Pothole in Kidnappers Lane, 31st January
item.description:
As marked on map. This pothole lies just beyond Cheringtons, heading towards the High School. It is a long and deep pothole that would damage a tyre, wheel and suspension. We've had to swerve round it as have others. As the road is narrow that puts you at risk of an accident. There are multiple other potholes in Kidnappers - how about a crew does an inspection and fixes the lot?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous pothole with loose gravel, skid risk and causing cars to swerve towards junction, 31st January
item.description:
One of the potholes in the photo does have white paint but the others do not. The cluster of potholes is now large enough that it's causing vehicles to deviate to the wrong side of the road early when navigating past the junction around parked cars. This has been observed to cause collision risk and is particularly problematic when the bus is turning left from cherry avenue. The amount of gravel causes a cycling skid risk

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Cherry Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous large deep pothole, 31st January
item.description:
This pothole is large and deep with lots of surrounding loose gravel which is a significant danger to cyclists. A cyclist was observed to fall from their bike due to this this pothole.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Beeches Road, Cheltenham
